text:
Ro: Hey guys, it’s Ro, welcome to another
Nerdy Nummies!

Ro: Today I have a special guest, it’s my
friend Josh.
Josh: Hi, nice to be back.

Ro: Yeah, you may recognize him, we’ve baked
together before. And today, we are

Ro: gonna be making something Adventure Time
themed, you may be able to tell by

Ro: our wardrobe. And specifically, we are
going to be making something
Ro: Snail themed from the episodes.

Josh: Yeah, he’s my favorite character on
the show, he’s in every single episode

Josh: and he’s so small, and he’s really
hard to see, but if you find him, he’s

Josh: waving at you and it’s the cutest
thing.

Ro: We thought it would be really fun for
this episode to play a game with you guys.

Ro: Soooooo, we will be moving the snail all
over the set, and the game is you

Ro: have to guess how many times the snail
moves.

Ro: Today we are gonna be making Adventure
Time Cinnamon Rolls.
Both: Let’s get started!

Josh: The mathematical ingredients you’ll
need are: 1 cup of warm milk, 3 cups of

Josh: flour and 1 cup of flour, they’re
separate because we’ll be adding them at

Josh: separate times. 2 Eggs, 1/3 cup of butter,
1/2 a cup of sugar, a packet
Josh: of yeast, and 1 teaspoon of salt.

Ro: You will also need 2 big mixing bowls.
And for the filling you’re gonna need

Ro: 1 cup of light brown sugar, 1/3 cup of
butter, 2-1/2 tablespoons of cinnamon

Ro: and 2 tablespoons of flour. Now are you
ready to put it all together?
Josh: I am. Ro: Let’s put it all together!

Ro: The 1st thing that we’re gonna do is
we’re gonna dissolve our yeast in

Ro: our milk, so you’re gonna take your
1 cup of warm milk and you’re gonna pour

Ro: it into the mixing bowl, and then Josh
I’m gonna have you open the yeast,

Josh: And now we’re gonna mix everything
together.

Ro: Once you’ve mixed together your milk
and yeast, now we’re gonna add the sugar.

Josh: And your 1 cup of flour, and then you’re
gonna mix it all together again.

Ro: Now that we’ve got our cinnamon roll
dough all mixed up and ready, we are

Ro: gonna cover it up and we're gonna let it sit for 30
minutes to let the dough rise.

Ro: Now that our mixture has had the time
to rise, we’re gonna open it up,

Ro: Radooo! Look at that! Way more fluffy!
And now we are gonna add the rest

Ro: of our ingredients. We’re gonna start
with a little bit of salt, 2 eggs.

Ro: Josh, you take 1, I’ll take 1, let’s
crack ‘em in there.
Josh: I hope I can do this… Oh!

Ro: Oh, oh, oh! Josh: I did it kinda, it’s
still… Ro: You did it, you did it!
Josh: Oh whoops! Ro: It’s good.
Ro: Then you’re gonna add butter.

Josh: And now you’re gonna add the 3 cups
of flour. And then we’re gonna mix
Josh: it all together again. For the 3rd time.

Ro: We just mixed up the dough and it’s
a little bit sticky, as you can see,

Ro: look at my hands, it’s just sticking
to it! So we’re gonna knead the dough for

Ro: 5 minutes. You’re gonna use a little
bit of flour. Josh, hit us with the flour.

Josh: Let’s do it! Ro: Yeah! and spread
it around so that it
Ro: won’t stick on your countertop.
Ro: Alright Josh, take half, just grab it.
Josh: Split the powerrrrrr! Ro: Oh my gosh!

Ro: Alright, and then we just knead it, working
it into the flour.

Ro: For about 5 minutes so it becomes less
sticky.

Josh: After you knead your dough, you’re
gonna take this olive oil spray and

Josh: then spray the entire inside of the
bowl.

Ro: Now you’re gonna take your dough, you’re
gonna put it in the greased bowl,

Ro: and we’re gonna cover it again with
the cling wrap,
Ro: and let is sit for 1 hour this time.

Ro: While the dough is rising, we’re gonna
be making our cinnamon roll filling,

Ro: the 1st thing that we’re gonna add is
our flour, then we’re gonna add the cinnamon
Josh: And… Ro: The light brown sugar.

Josh: And then we’re gonna mix up these
3 dry ingredients.

Ro: Now our dough has risen, I’m gonna take
off this plastic, here we go.
Ro: And look at that, woo-hooo!

Ro: Now is the fun part, Josh are you ready
to box?
Josh: I’m gonna punch this dough.

Ro: You’re just gonna punch it flat, punch,
punch, punch, punch, punch.
Ro: It’s a very fun part.
Josh: Karate chop!
Josh: Yeah! Ro: Alright, OK!

Ro: Now we are gonna roll out the dough, so
you’re gonna take a little bit of flour,

Ro: like we did before, sprinkle it on your
surface, and you’re gonna want to

Ro: roll out your dough to be about 21 inches
by 16 inches.

Ro: So just, roll it out really big, a lot
bigger than you’d think.

Ro: Dough is rolled out, and now we’re gonna
take a little bit of butter, this is room

Ro: temperature butter, so it’s really easy
to spread, and we’re gonna spread it on

Ro: the entire top. Now that we’ve got the
butter on, we’re gonna sprinkle on
Ro: all the cinnamon sugar filling.

Ro: OK, I’m gonna make it rain on this side
and then you make it rain on that side.

Josh: I make it rain, I make it rain! Ro:
Hmmm, hmmm, hmmm, hmmm!

Josh: Now that we’ve got our cinnamon on,
we’re gonna roll these cinnamon rolls.

Ro: 1, 2, 3 roll! Ready? 1, 2, 3… Both:
Roll!

Ro: Doesn’t this look like the burrito?
What’s it called?

Josh: Yeah the burrito! Ro: The Adventure
Time Burrito? Josh: Yeah, Jake’s Burritos.

Ro: This looks like his burrito! But now we’re
gonna take a sharp cutting knife,

Ro: and we’re just gonna cut, cut, cut,
cut! To make our little cinnamon rolls.

Ro: And you’re gonna cut your cinnamon rolls
about 2 inches wide.

Ro: And then, what we’re gonna do, and we’re
gonna make a whole bunch of these.

Ro: But you’re gonna unroll it, just a little
bit, and you’re gonna fold it under.

Ro: And we’re making the little snail’s
face, his little body.

Ro: Now we’re gonna make some fun details,
this is one of my favorite parts, with

Ro: the end pieces, of your big roll, because
these don’t look the best

Ro: for cinnamon rolls, I’m going to reuse
them. So I just took a little bit

Ro: of excess dough, rolled it to look like
a little arm, and then I’m gonna

Ro: stick it in between the folds right here,
to make it look like our little
Ro: snail is waving.

Ro: Now we’re gonna take a thin piece of
dough and we’re gonna make little antennas,
Ro: little snail antennas!

Ro: We’re just gonna roll the little top
and then stick them on every
Ro: single one of our cinnamon rolls.

Ro: Now you’re gonna put your Adventure
buns in the oven at 350 and bake for 25

Ro: minutes until they start to turn golden
brown. Josh: Ooooh!

Ro: While our adventure buns are baking, we’re
gonna make the cinnamon roll icing.

Ro: I’m gonna be adding a little bit of
cocoa powder, it’s unsweetened cocoa powder,

Ro: to make the icing, instead of the traditional
white icing, to make it brown so

Ro: that it will look like little snail. So
this is totally optional, you don’t

Ro: need to do this. We’re just gonna add
all of our ingredients into the bowl,
Ro: and mix it up.

Ro: Once the cinnamon rolls are done baking,
you’re gonna make sure they’ve

Ro: had plenty of time to cool. I’ve put
them on top of a drying rack and underneath

Ro: I put the baking sheet, and it will come
in handy because the icing is gonna
Ro: drip into the pan.

Josh: Final step, we’re gonna take our black
cookie icing with our number 1 tip on the

Josh: end, and we’re gonna draw his little
face. Ro: His little face!

Ro: Yeah he has a really simple face, so it’s
just 2 little dots and a little smile!
Both: Ta-da!

Ro: Here are Adventure Time Cinnamon Roll
Snails! I hope you guys liked ‘em,

Ro: these were so much fun to make, and, a
big thank you to my friend Josh!
Josh: Awwwww.

Ro: Thank you for helping me bake today. Josh:
It was a lot of fun!
Ro: It was so much fun!

Josh: And if you guys were playing the game
we mentioned in the beginning, write

Josh: in the comments how many times you saw
our little snail move around the kitchen.
Ro: Yeah, how many times did he move?

Ro: I will be putting links to Josh’s social
media down below, you’ve got twitter
Ro: and instagram right? Josh: I do.

Ro: Yeah, so go say hi to Josh over there.
And, I will be posting lots of pictures
Ro: of our baking creations today on Facebook, Twitter, Tumblr and Instagram.

Ro: And if you guys make any of these, please
send us photos, I get a big kick

Ro: out of seeing your baking creations. They
are so cool, they just make my day.
Ro: Alright, thanks again you guys, bye-bye!
Ro: And a snail wave!
